extends java.lang.Object

getNextEntry

public android.database.Cursor getNextEntry(int currentEntry,
                                            boolean backwards)
Gets the next or the previous entry id

Parameters:
currentEntry - The id of the current entry opened
backwards - If it should look for the previous image
Returns:
The cursor containing the single row or zero rows, with as only column the ID

hasNextEntry

public boolean hasNextEntry(int currentEntry,
                            boolean backwards)
Determine if entry has a next ( or the previous) entry

Parameters:
currentEntry - The id of the current entry opened
backwards - If it should look for the previous image
Returns:
true is it has a next or previous, false otherwise

deleteDay

public int deleteDay(int id,
                     boolean consistency)
Delete a day, this method could maintain the consistency of the data stored (in this case so a day can be deleted only if it has no entry)

Parameters:
id - the day id
consistency - true if method has to make sure about data consistency
Returns:
0 if the selected day is correctly deleted from db, the number of relative entries otherwise (in this case db isn't modified)
